PSBR.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: public sector borrowing requirement; the amount that a government has to borrow in a particular period of time to cover the difference between the money it gets from taxes and the amount it spends
PSBR.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: In Britain in recent years, the PSBR has been lower than the financial deficit because of the proceeds from privatisation  (=the income from the sale of previously government-owned companies).
